page.title: 13All Saints Church Wimbish
page.content: The original part of the church,the nave,was built in the first half of the 12th.century by the Fitzwalters of Wimbish Hall.The building has been added to over the centuries and the last major restoration was in the late 1880's.In 1086 there were 2 priests and 2 churches.Today there is 1 church & a chapel but only 0.5 of a priest as the vicar is shared with another parish.Church attendances these days are small though regular services are held.A Family Service is held on the first Sunday of the month and on other Sundays there are services of Mattins & Communion.There is a club for children under the age of eleven which is held on Tuesday evenings in St.Pauls chapel.The Village Library is also here. At Christmas,Easter & Harvest time special services are held when the church is then full.
